page.title: 02Landscape and Buildings
page.content: Darton is built in a{valley.}Running through Darton is a railway and running beside the village is the{ {River}Dearne. The landscape is gently rolling with lots of woodland, agricultural land and rough grazing. Kexbrough is built on the slope of the valley with Cawthorne Park at its peak at over 500ft above sea level.There is a{triangulation point}at 352ft on Barugh Green Hill and from this point it is possible to see for miles around.Darton possesses many interesting buildings such as Darton Church and Shaw Carpets.Shaws' is the largest carpet factory in Europe and is built on flat land beside the Dearne.The coalmine of Woolley village is very large and can be seen clearly from the M1.Finally there is Birthwaite Hall and Jacob Hall looking very picturesque on the hillside.
